unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post draft on home loan schemes:
normalised: Okay, here's a Quora post draft on home loan schemes:

unnormalised: **Home Loan Schemes - Need some clarity, yaar!**
normalised: **Home Loan Schemes - Need some clarity, friend!**

unnormalised: So, finally planning to buy my own little 2BHK in Navi Mumbai! So exciting, but also super confusing. I've been looking at home loan schemes and my head is spinning faster than a dhol during Ganpati Visarjan.
normalised: So, finally planning to buy my own little two B H K in Navi Mumbai! So exciting, but also super confusing. I've been looking at home loan schemes and my head is spinning faster than a dhol during Ganpati Visarjan.

unnormalised: Specifically, I'm trying to figure out which is better for me - a fixed rate loan vs. a floating rate one. My dad says fixed is safest, like a good LIC policy, but the interest rates seem a bit higher upfront. Thinking of checking with SBI or maybe HDFC first, heard they have good options, especially for first-time buyers.
normalised: Specifically, I'm trying to figure out which is better for me - a fixed rate loan versus a floating rate one. My dad says fixed is safest, like a good L I C policy, but the interest rates seem a bit higher upfront. Thinking of checking with S B I or maybe H D F C first, heard they have good options, especially for first-time buyers.

unnormalised: Has anyone recently navigated the home loan jungle? Any tips or recommendations? Anyone got a loan approved around Diwali 2023?
normalised: Has anyone recently navigated the home loan jungle? Any tips or recommendations? Anyone got a loan approved around Diwali two thousand and twenty three?

unnormalised: Also, I saw something about Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) on 26/01/2024. Does anyone know if I’d qualify? I’m salaried, making around Rs. 7 lakhs per year, and the apartment is about 600 sq ft (55.74 sqm).
normalised: Also, I saw something about Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (P M A Y) on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four. Does anyone know if I’d qualify? I’m salaried, making around rupee seven lakhs per year, and the apartment is about six hundred square feet (fifty five point seven four square meter).

unnormalised: And finally, are pre-payment charges still a thing? I want to be able to pay off extra whenever I can, like after getting my bonus around 15/08/2024. Is it better to visit the banks around 09:00 hrs to avoid the crowds?
normalised: And finally, are pre-payment charges still a thing? I want to be able to pay off extra whenever I can, like after getting my bonus around fifteenth august two thousand and twenty four. Is it better to visit the banks around nine A M to avoid the crowds?

unnormalised: Any advice, even if it's just "run far, run fast," would be appreciated! Thanks in advance!
normalised: Any advice, even if it's just "run far, run fast," would be appreciated! Thanks in advance!
